channel.title: Video Editing
channel.description:
[center]My friends, and I have made a video on "Tricking", "Flipping", or whatever you want to call it for a project. We want to know what people think of our Video Editing. We want to get very good at both editing and hope to learn parkour so we can have a nice channel on youtube that people would subscribe to us and such. Your Suggestions could be useful such as a good editing software, a good camera, and maybe so people have good suggestions on were to start Parkour at! [/center]
[center]The Software we use: [b]Windows Live Movie Maker[/b] (I know we are basic) Camera: [b]The First GoPro[/b][/center]
[center]Here is the link to our video - [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o19TxUfv4tc]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o19TxUfv4tc[/url][/center]
[center][size=14pt]It would be highly appreciated if you would help us out with some suggestions, and opinions! :D[/size][/center]

item.title: Video Editing
item.dc:creator: @robonick8 robonick8
item.description:
@robonick8 wrote:

Lin:

Please don’t ever use Windows Movie Maker again unless it’s for a quick re-render of an existing video. It’s a laggy, unstable memory-hogging piece of shit. Premiere Pro, Sony Vegas Pro or Final Cut Pro are your best options for the first stage of post-production. I took two years of video editing and used both Premiere Pro and Final Cut Pro so I’d definitely recommend them, but Sony Vegas Pro is decent if you want a powerful editor that won’t bog down your computer.

Thanks for the advice Will look in to all of them!!

Read full topic

item.title: Video Editing
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Please don’t ever use Windows Movie Maker again unless it’s for a quick re-render of an existing video. It’s a laggy, unstable memory-hogging piece of shit. Premiere Pro, Sony Vegas Pro or Final Cut Pro are your best options for the first stage of post-production. I took two years of video editing and used both Premiere Pro and Final Cut Pro so I’d definitely recommend them, but Sony Vegas Pro is decent if you want a powerful editor that won’t bog down your computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Video Editing
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“robonick8, post:8, topic:522261”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=640763.msg4317590#msg4317590 date=1371748846]
Get Vegas Pro or Adobe After Effects
[/quote]

I looked into Adobe After Effects and it looks good but also looks very difficult to use :/! Im sure I will learn though! Il check out the next one as well[/quote]
that’s how you know its good
give it a month or two of practice, watch some tutorials, and you’ll have it down pat

Read full topic
